snippet: A federal detention center in Karnes County, Tex., is the first to be built under new guidelines intended to improve living conditions and provide a less punitive setting.
abstract: Federal immigration detention center in Karnes County, Tex., is the first to be built under new guidelines intended to improve living conditions and provide a less punitive setting; detainees will be free to move through much of the center 24 hours a day amid unarmed staff members while awaiting immigration hearings.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and TIM EATON

lead_paragraph: A federal detention center in Karnes County, Tex., is the first to be built under new guidelines intended to improve living conditions and provide a less punitive setting.

headline.seo: Feds Unveil Model Immigration Detention Center
headline.main: Detention for Immigrants That Looks Less Like Prison
headline.print_headline: Detention for Immigrants That Looks Less Like Prison

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
